column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=1. Introduction
#Text=Optimized building skins can significantly reduce energy consumption for space heating , cooling , and electric lighting .
#Text=Using solar shading systems for natural cooling and daylighting control is an extensively researched topic in the area of energy-efficient building design .
#Text=Specifically , solar shading systems contribute significantly to controlling glare , regulating solar radiation , homogenizing illuminance levels , and protecting privacy .
#Text=On the basis of spatial positions , solar shading devices can be divided into three categories , namely , external intermediate and intermediate shading systems .
#Text=Many studies have demonstrated that external shading presents a better solar shading performance than internal and intermediate shading .

#Text=Regarding the operable and geometrical property , current solar shading systems consist of the fixed solar shading screen , fixed overhang , grating , operable solar shading screen , Venetian blinds , shutters , and roller blinds .
#Text=As one of the most commonly used external shading devices , a solar screen can efficiently scatter and redirect daylight .
#Text=Numerous studies have been conducted on improving the shading performance of solar screens by optimizing their geometrical dimensions , perforation percentages , and textures .
#Text=Moreover , much research has been conducted on using solar screens more effectively by adjusting their application methods on the basis of the facade orientation and shading periods .

#Text=Conventional research on the performance evaluation of shading devices has primarily focused on standard solar transmission ( e.g. , solar heat gain coefficient ) and visible daylight transmittance .

#Text=At present , concerns regarding the overall daylight quality of the indoor environment in a room with different shading devices have been increasing , and the research methods have been expanded to a wider range of simulations , regarding daylight , visual comfort , and energy demand , by using climate-based computer-aided dynamic simulation tools .

#Text=On the basis of the methods above , the performance of various kinds of materials for solar screens has been investigated , including metal mesh grids , perforated metal screens , and wooden screens .
#Text=The distinctive light performance of a woven fabric was demonstrated by Thomas in 1967 .
#Text=He demonstrated that the daylight transmission process of the woven fabric includes transmission through the holes , reflection by the fibers , and diffraction .

#Text=Likewise , mats woven of fine strips ( e.g. , rattan mats , bamboo mats ) have a similar daylight transmission mechanism as fabric materials , which allows them to be developed into daylighting/shading devices .
#Text=These mats can provide a preferable daylight transmission performance and combine aesthetics and functionality by delivering a striking visual appeal , safety , and energy savings .
#Text=However , as is shown in
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=a , traditional uniform woven mats show relatively weak shading performance because their thin warp and weft strips cannot significantly reduce direct solar radiation .
#Text=In contrast , as shown in
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=b , conventional thick perforated panels effectively block the direct solar beam but limit the access of diffuse daylight .
#Text=The weaknesses of the aforementioned panel types necessitate the search for an alternative material for solar screens .
#Text=To address this problem , this paper proposed a nonuniform woven panel woven from strips of different thicknesses .
#Text=The thick strips function as the main component to obstruct direct solar beams , whereas the side openings formed by curved thin strips allow almost exclusively diffuse daylight to penetrate .
#Text=In this study , bamboo was used as a demonstration material for the screen .
#Text=Due to the toughness and tensile strength of bamboo , fine strips can be easily curved and woven into mats with different patterns in the same way as fabrics .

#Text=In terms of the raw material itself , the ecology potentials of bamboo as an environmentally friendly resource have been an increasingly considered option in the field of renewable building materials .
#Text=Bamboo is widely planted and utilized as industrial or building material in Southern and Southeast Asia .
#Text=This material has a number of eco-features , such as rapid growth , a short vegetative cycle , and low-cost cultivation .
#Text=For example , Phyllostachys pubescen can grow to a height of 18 m in only 59 days after felling .
#Text=Bamboo products have lower eco-costs than tropical hardwood alternatives .
#Text=In addition , varied woven patterns endow mats with special aesthetic appearances for the envelope components .

#Text=Thus , the distinctive characteristics of bamboo warrant an investigation of the nonuniform solar shading screen that simultaneously takes into account the daylighting performance and eco-features of bamboo .

#Text=To the best of our knowledge , this panel has not been used as an external shading device , and no quantitative analysis has been conducted on its shading , daylighting , and mechanical performance .
